title: Instructional Design Integrating Worked Examples and Self-Explanation for Improving Programming Problem-Solving Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic programming syntax and algorithms, experiential knowledge of secondary education settings
context.additional_context: Focused on helping pre-service and in-service secondary teachers develop programming problem-solving strategies applicable to real educational settings.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze worked examples and explain step-by-step problem-solving strategies for complex programming tasks
Learners can systematically reflect on their problem-solving processes using guided questions to enhance self-explanation skills
Learners evaluate the transferability of problem-solving strategies through peer feedback in PBL environments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
